org.apache.archiva.redback.rbac

Interface Resource

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    JpaResource, MemoryResource

    public interface Resource
    Resource Resources are things that can be paired up with operations inside of a permission. Rbac doesn't strictly specify what a resource (or Object) is, so there are a couple of variations planned for resources. Initially the resource is simply a string representaton of whatever you desire to match up to an operation. Eventually we want to support different types of expression evaluation for these resources, like a tuple resource. *-* where wildcards can be used on the resource definition to streamline the assigning of permissions for _large_ sets of things.
    Author:
    Jesse McConnell, Joakim Erdfelt

      boolean isPattern()
      true if the identifer is a pattern that is to be evaluated, for example x.* could match x.a or x.b and x.** could match x.foo Jesse: See setPattern(boolean)

      void setPermanent(boolean permanent)
      Set flag indicating if the object is a permanent object or not.

      • setPattern
